title: How to Play the "No Results" Google Prank

steps.headline: Search for a popular search term.
steps.description: This could be anything from "linux" to "real estate". It doesn't have to be extremely popular, just common enough that there will be quite a few listings.

steps.headline: Add &num=0 to the end of the URL in the URL box.
steps.description: This forces Google to limit the number of results, in this case, to 0. Using a negative number instead will also work.

steps.headline: Show the URL to the person you want to prank.
steps.description: You can accomplish this in a variety of ways, including emailing them the link, or just showing them your computer screen. The person will likely be very surprised, and may call their friends over to see.

steps.headline: Conduct a search for something if the people being pranked start to worry.
steps.description: Once you conduct a search in the search box, it will show all results normally and you can laugh at them.

steps.headline: Search Google  for a popular term, but use an invalid date range in your query.
steps.description: An example would be the query, "linux daterange:99992-99993". At a glance, the five-digit code looks valid, but the date is not recognized.

steps.headline: Show the page to the person you want to prank.

tyn: A little bit of knowledge about Google
text: Steps Search for a popular search term. This could be anything from "linux" to "real estate". It doesn't have to be extremely popular, just common enough that there will be quite a few listings. Add &num=0 to the end of the URL in the URL box. This forces Google to limit the number of results, in this case, to 0. Using a negative number instead will also work. Show the URL to the person you want to prank. You can accomplish this in a variety of ways, including emailing them the link, or just showing them your computer screen. The person will likely be very surprised, and may call their friends over to see. Conduct a search for something if the people being pranked start to worry. Once you conduct a search in the search box, it will show all results normally and you can laugh at them. Alternative Method (using the daterange function) Search Google  for a popular term, but use an invalid date range in your query. An example would be the query, "linux daterange:99992-99993". At a glance, the five-digit code looks valid, but the date is not recognized. Show the page to the person you want to prank.
sentences: Steps Search for a popular search term.
This could be anything from "linux" to "real estate".
It doesn't have to be extremely popular, just common enough that there will be quite a few listings.
Add &num=0 to the end of the URL in the URL box.
This forces Google to limit the number of results, in this case, to 0.
Using a negative number instead will also work.
Show the URL to the person you want to prank.
You can accomplish this in a variety of ways, including emailing them the link, or just showing them your computer screen.
The person will likely be very surprised, and may call their friends over to see.
Conduct a search for something if the people being pranked start to worry.
Once you conduct a search in the search box, it will show all results normally and you can laugh at them.
Alternative Method (using the daterange function) Search Google  for a popular term, but use an invalid date range in your query.
An example would be the query, "linux daterange:99992-99993".
At a glance, the five-digit code looks valid, but the date is not recognized.
Show the page to the person you want to prank.
